questions.question: Following the recent deadly earthquakes in eastern Afghanistan, which two provinces were reported by Australian coverage as the worst affected, with thousands of homes destroyed and a rapidly rising death toll?
questions.explanation: Australian reporting (notably ABC and SBS) identified the eastern provinces Kunar and Nangarhar as the worst-hit areas, reporting thousands of homes destroyed and a rapidly rising death toll in the immediate aftermath of the quakes.

questions.question: Following Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's late-night phone call with US President Donald Trump, how did Albanese describe the conversation in his public readout?
questions.explanation: Albanese publicly flagged the late-night call and described it as a "warm and constructive" conversation about trade, critical minerals and shared security interests, according to ABC News coverage.

questions.question: In the Cobblebank (outer-west Melbourne) incident that left two boys dead, how did Victoria Police describe the nature of the attack?

answers.text: A lone attacker using a firearm who fled on foot
A spontaneous fight between the two victims and another teen
A targeted attack by multiple masked males armed with machetes or long-edged weapons
A domestic incident involving family members at a private residence

questions.explanation: Victoria Police said the deaths were connected and were being treated as a targeted attack with the "hallmarks of youth gang activity," describing multiple masked male offenders armed with machetes or long‑edged weapons (CCTV showed masked offenders carrying weapons). Reports about a vehicle are inconsistent; the police/ABC account does not definitively confirm that detail.

questions.question: Following the APL's announcement this week about Western United, what did the league decide for the club's participation in the 2025/26 A‑League Men’s and Women’s seasons?

answers.text: The APL permanently expelled Western United from the A‑Leagues with no option to return.
The APL allowed Western United to compete as normal while its owner was in liquidation, keeping all players under contract.
The APL placed Western United's Club Participation Agreement into conditional hibernation, so the club will not compete next season and players were released to seek other contracts.
The APL merged Western United with another club to keep an expanded competition size for 2025/26.

questions.explanation: The APL announced it had placed Western United's Club Participation Agreement into conditional hibernation for 2025/26, meaning the club will not compete next season and the playing group was released so players can seek other contracts. Media reports also indicate head coach John Aloisi is now a free agent. The APL statement did not describe a permanent expulsion, continued competition, or any merger.

questions.question: Australian outlets reported that Lady Gaga released a new single, "The Dead Dance", with a gothic music video tied to Netflix's Wednesday (season 2). Which filmmaker directed the clip?
questions.explanation: Coverage in Australian entertainment pages notes that the music video for Lady Gaga's "The Dead Dance" was directed by Tim Burton, who provided the gothic, horror-tinged visuals tied to Wednesday season 2.
